Issues.Title: Shuffle property location
Issues.Body: Remake of https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/2869 due to CI issues
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Shuffle property location" (#3111)

Issues.Title: Remove custom copy of PtrToStringChars
Issues.Body:
This PR removes WPF's custom implementation of `PtrToStringChars` in favor of the built-in version. The custom version was originally introduced to work around CAS performance issues. However, since Core did not bring any of the CAS infrastructure forward, there's no need for the custom copy.

Related: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/31406
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove custom copy of PtrToStringChars" (#3117)

Issues.Title: WPF app crash in EnsureChildren() with Null Reference Exception
Issues.Body:
Content in a list control (DataGrid, ListBox, etc.) is cleaned when leaving the visual tree.  In some circumstances, the cleaning can raise automation events, which causes COM to start a nested message pump.  If this happens to see a WM_SIZE message, the resulting layout pass and subsequent rebuild of the automation tree can happen while the visual tree is in a torn state (visual children lists in the process of being cleared can contain nulls).  Some automation peers aren't prepared for this, and NRE.

[Port of servicing fix for .NET 4.7-4.8]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF app crash in EnsureChildren() with Null Reference Exception" (#3116)

Issues.Title: DocumentViewer cannot select all multi-line sentence of Japanese which is contained in one TextBox.
Issues.Body:
When loading certain XPS documents, bugs in the construction of FixedPage's "semantic object model" lead to incorrect ordering of text runs, causing editing operations like selection and copy to omit part of the text or include it in the wrong order.

[Port of servicing fix for .NET 4.7-4.8]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DocumentViewer cannot select all multi-line sentence of Japanese which is contained in one TextBox." (#3115)

Issues.Title: WPF is creating and formatting stack traces when removing HwndSource from visual tree
Issues.Body:
Removing an HwndSource from the visual tree exercises logic that was recently augmented to help track down an unexplained crash.  The new logic creates a stack trace, but does even in the normal case, causing a non-trivial perf hit for no reason.

[Port of servicing fix for .NET 4.8.]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF is creating and formatting stack traces when removing HwndSource from visual tree" (#3114)

Issues.Title: Copying data from WPF DataGrid crashes application with error "(CLIPBRD_E_CANT_OPEN)"
Issues.Body:
DataGrid copy command crashes if some other process has locked the clipboard.

The standard behavior (in TextBox and other apps like Word, Notepad, etc.) is to fail silently - no copy, but no crash.

[Port of servicing fix for .NET 4.5.2-4.8]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Copying data from WPF DataGrid crashes application with error "(CLIPBRD_E_CANT_OPEN)"" (#3113)

Issues.Title: Tooltip crash [Watson] clr20r3: NULL_POINTER_READ_c0000005_PresentationFramework.dll!System.Windows.Controls.PopupControlService.OnPostProcessInput
Issues.Body:
NRE when closing tooltips in some situations, due to re-entrancy.

[Port of servicing fix for .NET 4.8]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tooltip crash [Watson] clr20r3: NULL_POINTER_READ_c0000005_PresentationFramework.dll!System.Windows.Controls.PopupControlService.OnPostProcessInput" (#3112)

Issues.Title: Positioning a window in WPF (Top and Left Properties) with dpiAwareness in PerMonitorV2 mode
Issues.Body:
Hello,

For a WPF project in VB, I retrieve the mouse coordinates using a Hook mouse (MSLLHOOKSTRUCT) to display a window on the desktop according to the selection rectangle defined by the user.
I noticed that the mouse coordinates do not take into account the screen scales. 
Is this normal?
So, I had to retrieve this scale using the GetDpiForMonitor API and created a manifest file with DPI recognition per screen.
<dpiAwareness xmlns = “https://schemas.microsoft.com/SMI/2016/WindowsSettings”> PerMonitorV2 </dpiAwareness>.
In a test project, I noticed problems with the bad positioning of my window in relation to the placement request.
Here are my tests with the Left property of a window:
Screen resolution 1: 1680x1050
Screen resolution 2: 1600x900

Screen 1 = 100% - Screen 2 = 150%.**
Window on screen 1, asks to switch to screen 2
Ask left = 1680 after moving : left = 1120 on screen 2
The left was divided by 1.5 after the move.

Window on screen 2, asks to switch to screen 1
Ask left = 100 after moving : left = 150 on screen 1
The left was multiplied by 1.5 after the move.

Screen 1 = 150% - Screen 2 = 100%.
Window on screen 1, asks to switch to screen 2
Ask left = 1680 after moving : left = 2520 on screen 2
The left was multiplied by 1.5 after the move.

Window on screen 2, asks to switch to screen 1
Ask left = 100 after moving : left = 66.66 on screen 1
The left was divided by 1.5 after the move.

Is this management of the values of the positioning properties correct?
These requested positions do not correspond to the physical position where I want to place my window.
Without DPI recognition per screen, the positioning of the window respects the requested coordinates. The Top and Left properties do not change despite the different scales.

You can perform the test using the zip file.

![Left_Window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66659162/84110365-06a1cb80-aa25-11ea-80bd-e7cbac59e4e5.png)

[WpfApp2.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4751287/WpfApp2.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Positioning a window in WPF (Top and Left Properties) with dpiAwareness in PerMonitorV2 mode" (#3105)

Issues.Title: Replace hardcoded backslashes with Path.DirectorySeparatorChar and fix WinFX casing (daviddenis-stx, Nirmal4G, PaulEremeeff)
Issues.Body:
This includes @daviddenis-stx's Path.DirectorySeparatorChar fixes and the first two commits from @Nirmal4G and @PaulEremeeff to fix WinFX casing. (Thank you!)

The issue is described in more detail in PRs #2877 and #2975.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace hardcoded backslashes with Path.DirectorySeparatorChar and fix WinFX casing (daviddenis-stx, Nirmal4G, PaulEremeeff)" (#3101)

Issues.Title: WPF App crashes due to COMException (UCEERR_RENDERTHREADFAILURE) from System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel.SyncFlush
Issues.Body:
Problem description:  HostVisual interacts with its rendering channel on the wrong thread.  This can lead to render thread failures, perhaps minutes or hours after the bad interaction.

[Port of servicing fix for .NET 4.7-4.8]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF App crashes due to COMException (UCEERR_RENDERTHREADFAILURE) from System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel.SyncFlush" (#3100)

Issues.Title: SplashScreen not centered when the size for apps and text is not set to 100%
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.4
* Windows version 10 1909 & 2004
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Not tested.
 
 **Problem description:**
When UHD & 4K monitors are used, text is usually so small that users normally *change the size of apps and text* **to a value larger** than the 100% recommended value. This can be changed in Settings -> Display. When this setting is not the default 100%, SplashScreen does not appear centered in the screen.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6704109/83767483-ffbe3600-a67d-11ea-866d-d299a7df978c.png)

  **Actual behavior:**
Under the former scenario SplashScreen of a WPF App (.NET Core) does not appear in the center of the screen.

 **Expected behavior:**
According the documentation at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.splashscreen?view=netcore-3.1
> The SplashScreen class displays the splash screen as soon as possible after the application is started. The splash screen is displayed by using native code, before the WPF application instance is created. **The splash screen is displayed in the center of the screen.** When the application is loaded, the splash screen fades.

**Minimal repro:**
Using Visual Studio 2019, create a new project/solution of the **WPF App (.NET Core)** type. Add an image to the project and under its Properties set Compilation Action as **SplashScreen**. There really is no coding involved at all, just adding an image and set it up properly.

Then change your display settings and set the above-mentioned configuration to any value larger than 100% and run the application. The SplashScreen will not appear on the center of the screen.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SplashScreen not centered when the size for apps and text is not set to 100%" (#3090)

Issues.Title: WPF TextBlock FailFast in System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.IsAtCaretUnitBoundary when TextWrapping="Wrap" and inconsistent text display (missing text)
Issues.Body:
Problem description:  In TextBlock with word-wrapping, certain strings lead to disappearing text, and FailFast exceptions during editing operations.
 
[Port of servicing bug for .NET 4.7-4.8]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF TextBlock FailFast in System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.IsAtCaretUnitBoundary when TextWrapping="Wrap" and inconsistent text display (missing text)" (#3099)

Issues.Title: Add Microsoft.Expression.Drawing
Issues.Body:
Can the source code of Microsoft.Expression.Drawing be added to this (or another OSS) repository. It contains Shapes classes like: Arc, Arrows, Callouts, Hexagon, Pentagon, Ring, Star and triangle. 

I would love to have them in .NET Core and WinUI too.

Issues.Title: Remove dependency on built-in WinRT support
Issues.Body:
Remove dependency on built-in WinRT support by copying over portions of C#/WinRT and slimming down the projected interfaces.

Ryland and I did ad-hoc testing of the spell checker component and it worked.

Once we believe this is ready for merge, I'll cherry-pick it for release/5.0-preview6.

cc: @rladuca @fabiant3 @ryalanms @AaronRobinsonMSFT @jeffschwMSFT

Issues.Title: the IsHitTestVisible Property doesn't work
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version:  3.1.300
* Windows version:  window10 professional  2004

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 
```

<Window x:Class="DivergenceMeter.MainWindow"
        WindowStyle="None" 
        ResizeMode="NoResize" 
        AllowsTransparency="True"  
        Background="Transparent" 
        IsHitTestVisible="False"
        >
```

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25658690/83647847-f4b8c680-a5e7-11ea-8276-f35c6349c565.gif)

 **Expected behavior:**

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25658690/83647874-fbdfd480-a5e7-11ea-9c8d-152c7f3c2d04.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "the IsHitTestVisible Property doesn't work" (#3088)
